From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia


2022 American drama film

Running time131 minutes[1]CountryUnited StatesLanguageEnglish
Freedom's Path is a 2022 historical war drama film written, directed and produced by Brett Smith in his feature length debut. It stars Gerran Howell, RJ Cyler, and Ewen Bremner. Based on the American Civil War, it won multiple film festival awards in 2022 and had a limited theatrical run from February 3, 2023.


Synopsis[edit]
A Union soldier is rescued by a free Black man and his friends, who run a portion of the Underground Railroad. Meanwhile, a ruthless slave catcher is looking to bring them down.[2]

Cast[edit]
Gerran Howell as William
RJ Cyler as Kitch
Ewen Bremner as Silas
Harrison Gilbertson as Lewis
Mia Tucker as Nora
Carol Sutton as Caddy
Afemo Omilami as Ellis Freeman
Steven Swadling as Jake Nilsson
Thomas Jefferson Byrd as Abner
Production[edit]
The film is based on a short of the same name that Brett Smith released in 2015. The feature length film was produced by Rocket Soul Studios and 1812 Films, with Soulidifly Productions, Rock Hill Studios, Room In The Sky Films and Chicago Media Angels. Producers were AJ Winslow, Jim Pidgeon, Neko Sparks and Steven Swadling. The film has a promotional partnership with Allen Media Group.[3]

Filming[edit]
Principal photography took place in October 2019.[4] It was largely filmed in and around Fayetteville with filming locations including Prairie Grove Battlefield Park, War Eagle Mill, Lincoln, and Cane Hill.[5]

Release[edit]
The film premiered at the Cinequest Film & Creativity Festival on April 15, 2022.[6] The film was distributed by Xenon Pictures in 128 AMC and Regal Cinemas theaters on February 3, 2023 with part of ticket sales be donated to Historically Black Colleges and Universities.[7]

Reception[edit]
In September 2022 the film won the  Director’s Choice award at the Gig Harbor Film Festival in Washington State.[8] It also received the Audience Award at both the Cinequest San Jose Festival and Fayetteville Film Festival in 2022. It won the ‘Best of Fest’ award at the Lone Star Film Festival, along with the ‘Festival Award’ at the San Diego International Film Festival and the Special Jury Prize at the St. Louis International Film Festival, all also in 2022.[9]

^ "Freedom's Path' Trailer: RJ Cyler and Gerran Howell Take Center Stage in Civil War Drama". Collider. January 18, 2023.

^ "'Freedom's Path': Ewen Bremner, RJ Cyler & Gerran Howell Lead American Civil War Movie Now Underway". Deadline. October 14, 2019.

^ "Fayetteville-filmed movie 'Freedom's Path' coming to theaters in February". Fayetteville Flyer.

^ "Freedom's Path' Teaser: First Look At Civil War Drama Starring Gerran Howell, RJ Cyler & Ewen Bremner". Deadline. March 17, 2022.

^ Goldsmith, Jill (February 3, 2023). "Animated Sundance Sleeper 'The Amazing Maurice' A Viva Pictures Milestone; 'Freedom's Path' Marks Black History Month – Specialty Preview". Deadline Hollywood. Retrieved February 16, 2023.

^ "'Freedom's Path' claims Director's Choice award at Gig Harbor Film Festival". Gigharbornow.org. September 30, 2022.

^ ""Freedom's Path," Filmed in Fayetteville, Sets February Debut". Onlyinark.com. January 11, 2023.
